Methods in ajaxservlet.accounting that return StoredFilter
 StoredFilter UserAccount.getFilter(java.lang.String coll, java.lang.String cat)
          get a filter from the user base given the collection and category -- if there's no specific filter for the parameter, looks for a category filter ("Any-Collection") -- if no filter is found, returns null

 void UserAccount.addFilter(StoredFilter sf)
          add the filter to the userfilters base

Methods in ajaxservlet.formator that return StoredFilter
static StoredFilter FilterBase.get(java.lang.String coll, java.lang.String cat)
          provides the filter corresponding to the given category & collection (or the "Any-Collection" one if it doesn't exist)
static StoredFilter DisplayFilterFactory.getStoredFilter(java.lang.String coll, java.lang.String cat, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
          provides the right StoredFilter given the collection, the category and an Http request First looks up the userbase, then the filterbase

DynamicDisplayFilter(StoredFilter sf, java.lang.String coll)
